answer: 1 mark per box up to a maximum of 4 marks:

1 mark for any of the following bullet points:
• To write programming code.
• To debug programming code.
• To compile/interpret code.

1 mark per bullet up to a maximum of 2 marks for each construct (4
marks in total), e.g.:
• Sequence…
• …e.g. display payment details once a room has been selected
• …e.g. send confirmation email after successfully entering
payment details
• Selection…
…e.g. if payment details are successful then send
confirmation email
• ...e.g. if a valid date has been entered then display a list of
available rooms
• Iteration….
• ….e.g. repeat code until a date has been entered
• ….e.g. repeat code until a room has been selected
guidance:
Award 1 mark for stating a construct and then 1
mark for a suitable example that is relevant to the
context.
Award a maximum of two marks for each
programming construct.

answer:
1 mark per bullet up to a maximum of 2 marks, e.g.:
• Blackbox testing
• Whitebox testing
• Alpha testing
• Beta testing

1 mark per bullet up to a maximum of 2 marks:
• Waterfall lifecycle
• Agile methodologies
• Extreme programming
• Spiral model
• Rapid Application Development
guidance: Allow RAD as acronym this time

answer:
1 mark per bullet up to a maximum of 2 marks for each advantage (4
marks in total), e.g.:
• Saves times (1) as code does not need to be rewritten (1)
• Code may already be tested (1) which will therefore save
development//debugging time (1)
• More efficient code (1) which will use less memory//be easier
to maintain (1)
• May require less technical knowledge (1) as code can used
rather than written (1)
guidance:
Award a maximum of two marks for each
advantage.
Allow other suitable examples.

answer:
1 mark per bullet up to a maximum of 4 marks, e.g.:
• makes use of a (while) loop…
• ….which will continually check the telephone number….
• …and repeatedly ask for a telephone number to be re-
entered….
• ….until the rules have been met

1 mark for stating a suitable procedure name and 1 mark for a
suitable purpose (4 marks in total), e.g.:
• Procedure Name: registerAccount
• Purpose: To load up the registration page when the user
wants to create a new account
• Procedure Name: validateDetails
• Purpose: To check the suitability of a new username and
password entered
• Procedure Name: checkLogin
• Purpose: Checks a username and password matches those
stored when a customer logs in
• Procedure Name: checkStock
• Purpose: Checks an item is in stock before the item can be
added to a shopping basket
guidance:
The procedure name must be relevant to the
context in the question.
Both a procedure name and purpose must be stated
for 2 marks.
Allow other suitable examples that are relevant to
the context.

answer:
1 mark per bullet up to a maximum of 4 marks, e.g.:
• by reference will receive the memory location of where the
data/variable is stored
• by value will receive a copy of the data/variable
guidance:
Must cover by reference and by value to be given
full marks.

guidance:
Marks should be awarded for correct swapping of
adjacent items that are out of order. Therefore if the
previous step is incorrect but the candidate has
followed through with the correct answer then marks
should be awarded.

numbers

• …To allow the contents of two variables to be
swapped
• …to ensure that data is not overwritten

1 mark per bullet up to a maximum of 2 marks, e.g.:

in a pass

sorted

number

• Used to determine if is an odd or even number
a

• Search each slot in order // sequentially
• Search until the first empty slot is found

1 mark per bullet up to a maximum of 7 marks, e.g.:
• Defining the function correctly
findFirst
• Suitable logic for checking the first time slot
• Suitable logic for checking the next time slot…
• Suitable loop to check all time slots

-1
available
• Suitable use of variable names and indentation
guidance:
Example solution:
function findFirst()
count = 0
do
found = false
""
if customerID[2, count] == then
found = true
else
count = count + 1
endif
until count == 10 or found == true
if found == True
return customerID[0,count]
else
return -1
endif
endfunction
There are many different ways that this function could
have been achieved. Therefore other alternative methods
should be given credit.

answer:
A procedure does not return a value / a function will
return a value.

1 mark per bullet up to a maximum of 2 marks, e.g.:
• Line 04 is calling the procedure
• Line 06 is defining the procedure

1 mark per bullet up to a maximum of 2 marks, e.g.:
• the variable is global (set on line 03)
change
• the value is printed after it has been changed to 0
by the procedure
